bibl.title: The Shipwrecks of Heracleion-Thonis: An Overview.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. General Information on the Shipwrecks. - 3. Preliminary Study of Naval Architecture. - 4. The Context of the Shipwrecks. - More than 60 ships were identified. 40 % of them are most probably Ptolemaic in date.

bibl.title: Achievements and Problems of Modern Egyptology. Proceedings of the International Conference Held in Moscow on September 29 - October 2, 2009.

bibl.seg: Davis Fabre & Alexander Belov, The Shipwrecks of Heracleion-Thonis: An Overview.

Galina A. Belova & Sergej V. Ivanov (edd.), Achievements and Problems of Modern Egyptology. Proceedings of the International Conference Held in Moscow on September 29 - October 2, 2009 (Moscow, 2012) pp. 108-120, 1 tabl., 6 figg.

1. Introduction. - 2. General Information on the Shipwrecks. - 3. Preliminary Study of Naval Architecture. - 4. The Context of the Shipwrecks. - More than 60 ships were identified. 40 % of them are most probably Ptolemaic in date.
